column1: Topic title: Rafizi promises new Tabung Haji expose next week

column8: text

PETALING JAYA: PKR vice-president Rafizi Ramli says he will release an expose related to Tabung Haji next week, following a federal minister’s claim that RM500 million in savings were withdrawn by contributors who believed Rafizi’s slander.In a statement, Rafizi, the Pandan MP, said: “Even though the minister in the prime minister’s department, Jamil Khir Baharom, did not dare mention my name, he was referring to me when he talked about an opposition MP who defamed Tabung Haji.“Since he was referring to me and accused me of defaming Tabung Haji, I will once more focus my attention on Tabung Haji’s financial losses and leakages.”He was referring to media reports in which Jamil said some 3,600 contributors withdrew from performing the hajj because they “lost faith in Tabung Haji”.“Imagine if Tabung Haji funds were already invested in assets like homes, factories and land, where would we find the cash to return the money to the contributors? Fortunately we have enough cash for the withdrawals,” Jamil was reported as saying yesterday.Last April, Rafizi pleaded not guilty to charges of criminal defamation, for allegedly defaming Tabung Haji, on February 18 in his blog.The punishment for defamation is a maximum two years’ jail or a fine or both.Previously, Rafizi had claimed Tabung Haji’s reserves suffered a deficit for two consecutive years.Rafizi said that Tabung Haji hasn’t yet given a satisfactory answer to his exposes on its financial losses.“If the upcoming exposes are not answered honestly and sincerely, more depositors will withdraw their funds from Tabung Haji because they will lose more trust in the management who are seen as political pawns.”Rafizi added that his case would go to trial in May.“I will call on many witnesses, including former Bank Negara governor Zeti Akhtar Aziz, who first reminded Tabung Haji that its reserves were in the negative.” http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...pose-next-week/
